question_text: Select two outcomes of incorrectly populating memory slots in a quad-channel motherboard.
answer_options: Memory channels will be disabled or operate in single-channel mode
BIOS will automatically adjust timings for performance boost
Memory will overheat due to bus congestion
System may fail POST or operate at reduced memory throughput
ECC will automatically compensate for mismatched modules
correct_answer: Memory channels will be disabled or operate in single-channel mode
System may fail POST or operate at reduced memory throughput
explanation: Incorrect population or mismatched modules can prevent multi-channel operation and degrade overall system performance.
